turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about U.S. Committee for Refugees and Immigrants.
turn.2: 1) Refoulement/Physical Protection 2) Freedom of Movement and Residence 3) Detention/Access to Courts 4) Right to Earn a Livelihood and 5) Public Relief and Education.
turn.4: On June 19, 2008, the U.S. Committee for Refugees and Immigrants and its research partners released the World Refugee Survey 2008 with events around the world.
turn.6: Within the annual publication, USCRI released a list of the Ten Worst Places for Refugees.
turn.7: What was the list of the ten worst places?
turn.8: Countries and regions were graded based on their commitment to standards outlined in the 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees.
turn.9: What places were ranked the lowest?
turn.10: As determined by the Committee, the 'Ten Worst Places' were: Bangladesh, China, Europe, Iraq, Kenya, Malaysia, Russia, Sudan, and Thailand.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Sixty countries hosting the largest numbers of refugees were profiled in the 2008 survey.
